item.title: Report X-2023090552
item.description:
Report X-2023090552

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: CHANTILLY
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking in trailer 56010 from Hagerstown. QA was alerted and package was placed in a plastic salvage drum. DescribePack: All four bottles of condenser coil cleaner had slightly loose caps. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened and bottles were placed upright.

item.title: Report E-2023090782
item.description:
Report E-2023090782

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: VIRGINIA BEACH
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, diesel and gasoline were inadvertently mixed during fuel delivery. During the pump out of the tank, the tanker was overfilled, resulting in the release of approximately 50 gallons to pavement. The fuel reached a nearby drain. HEPACO was immediately contacted, located the affected drain, and noted no fuel in the downstream inlet. HEPACO flushed the drain system with clean water and captured the resulting fuel/water mixture with a vacuum truck. Booms were placed in the inlet to capture any residual fuel. Cleanup was managed by CDG on behalf of Eagle.

item.title: Report E-2023090778
item.description:
Report E-2023090778

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: NEWPORT NEWS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver spilled approximately 20 gallons of Premium at a 7-11 location. Driver said the product would fit but product backed up around fitting and released onto the ground. During investigation determined driver overfilled tank.
